item.description:
6:30-7 snacks and schmoozing (beverages and snacks- other food can be purchased next door)
7-8:00 presentation
8-8:45 discussion
8:45- whenever continued discussion at packards

$5 suggested donation will be collected at the door

What is Web 3.0?
also referred to as semantic web -'semantic' is a fancy term that refers to the way computers communicate and organize information.

What is a Content Management System?
A way to streamline website creation, updating and management. Examples are wordpress, joomla, cms made simple, drupal (also known as cms made complicated- j/k) and many more...

Guest Speaker Dr. Mark A. Friedman will speak on the following:

Humans are capable of using the Web to find the birth date of Abe Lincoln. A computer cannot accomplish this task because web pages are designed to be read by people, not machines.

The semantic web is a vision of information that is understandable by computers, so that they can perform more of the work involved in finding, combining and acting upon information on the web.
The semantic web is a game-changer in how website developers will think about and structure web content.

CMS's will be instrumental in creating the semantic web as they can be built to emit structured information that other sites and tools can consume.

Many semantic web technologies are in place today. A (partial) semantic web is not far away. CMS's support these technologies to different degrees. This talk will give an overview of semantic web technologies focusing on those that are already or nearly in place, and a review of the capabilities/plans of several content management systems for supporting these technologies.

Links:
http://en.wikipedia.o...

group.name: Northampton Web Developers/ Web Designers Meetup Group

item.name: The intersection of Web Design/Development, Web 3.0 & Content Management Systems
